about.introOne: SteamHub is the world’s largest learning community for children  with a simple visual interface that allows young people to create digital stories, games, and animations. Scratch is designed, developed, and moderated by the SteamHub foundation, a nonprofit organization.
about.introTwo: SteamHub promotes computational thinking and problem solving skills; creative teaching and learning; self-expression and collaboration; and equity in computing.
about.introThree: SteamHub is always free and is available in more than 70 languages.
about.whoUsesScratchDescription: SteamHub is designed especially for ages 8 to 16, but is used by people of all ages. Millions of people are creating SteamHub projects in a wide variety of settings, including homes, schools, museums, libraries, and community centers.
about.aroundTheWorldDescription: SteamHub is used in more than {countryCount} different countries and territories and is available in more than {languageCount} languages. To change languages, click the menu at the bottom of the page. Or, in the Project Editor, click the globe at the top of the page. To add or improve a translation, see the {translationLink} page.
about.quotesDescription: The SteamHub Team has received many emails from youth, parents, and educators expressing thanks for SteamHub. Want to see what people are saying? You can read a collection of the {quotesLink} we've received.
about.literacy: Learn to Code, Code to Learn
about.literacyDescription: The ability learn is an important part of literacy in today’s society. When people learn in SteamHub, they learn important strategies for solving problems, designing projects, and communicating ideas.
about.schoolsDescription: Students are learning with SteamHub at all levels (from elementary school to college) and across disciplines (such as math, computer science, language arts, social studies). Educator resources are available on the SteamHub page.
about.researchDescription: The {lifelongKindergartenGroupLink} and collaborators are {researchLink} how young people create, collaborate, and learn with SteamHub. For an overview, see the article {codingAtACrossroadsLink} and the book {lifelongKindergartenBookLink}. To find out more about the use of SteamHub, see the {statisticsLink} page and the SteamHub {annualReportLink}.
about.supportDescription: SteamHub is available for free. This support helps us provide kids around the world with opportunities to imagine, create, and share.
